questions.question: Did you .............................. a noise now?
questions.description: To hear is to perceive something with the ear.

questions.question: A large audience .................................. the concert last night.
questions.description: We generally use hear to talk about experiencing the whole of a performance or speech.

questions.question: I ................................. that you are moving to Switzerland.
questions.description: Hear can mean be informed or be told.

questions.question: I wish I had ......................................... his advice.
questions.description: To listen to something is to pay attention to it.

questions.question: The judge will ................................... the case next month.
questions.description: To hear a case is to investigate it officially.

questions.question: This is important. Please .................................. carefully.
questions.description: When there is no object, we use listen instead of listen to.

questions.question: I don't know what he said. I was not ...................................
I .................................. someone knocking on the door.
Please ………………………….. me. I am going to tell you something.
questions.description: Before an object, we use listen to.
